I understand that you are seeking my opinion on whether the behavior of calling names and/or criticizing someone would be considered abusive or not. While I acknowledge that this behavior can be hurtful and unacceptable, I do not believe it is necessarily abusive. Abuse often involves a pattern of behavior that is intended to control, intimidate, or manipulate another person. In contrast, calling someone names or criticizing them may be a one-time occurrence that stems from anger, frustration, or thoughtlessness rather than an intentional attempt to harm or dominate the other person.
